result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:50 PM Defendant Tina M Burgess not in court.  Attorney Nick Cirilli appearing for Gary Cirilli appeared by video for Tina M Burgess.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 21CF1 and 22CF39. Court speaks to the case. Court advises to file motions for state and defense. Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:45 PM Defendant Tina M Burgess appeared by video.  Attorney Gary S. Cirilli appeared by video for Tina M Burgess.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court speaks on the motion regarding the two issues. State makes argument over the statute. Defense has a rebuttal argument over the statute. Court will review more information and schedule another hearing. Bond continued.
Oral ruling scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:16 PM Defendant Tina M Burgess appeared by video.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gary S. Cirilli appeared by video for Tina M Burgess. Bond Continued
Oral arguments scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:25 AM Defendant Tina M Burgess in court.  Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court for Tina M Burgess.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties are not in agreement to offer.  Parties request to submit letter briefs to the court in regards to remanding and hospitalization in lieu of jail.  Court will schedule oral arguments if he feels letter briefs are not sufficient after receiving them.  Court advises briefs to be submitted to the court within two weeks.  Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Status hearing on July 20, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on June 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant appears in court with Attorney Cirlli in court. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties speak on status. Court sets final pre trial for June 8th at 3:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on June 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
